s.text: "I waited and waited," A. wrote me.
"I waited and waited," A. wrote me.
Please wait to see a response from the system with your confirmation."
Then Burke yelled at me for having the temerity to even suggest that the ex-U-Haul employee K. quoted might be right.
I received somewhere around 2.7 million e-mails from Slate readers asking for help in the battle against poor customer service.

To add insult to injury, when A. finally spoke to a "live" person (you will soon see why the word "live" is in quotation marks), he asked to have the $5.

To add insult to injury, when A. finally spoke to a "live" person (you will soon see why the word "live" is in quotation marks), he asked to have the $5.
So, for those of you asking highly technical questions concerning the operation of your personal computers, let it be known across the land that the Shopping Avenger still writes on papyrus.

It is I, the great Shopping Avenger, who has toiled without pause this past month (all right, I paused) to right the wrongs inflicted on the buying masses by the dark forces of turbocharged capitalism.
She asked me to identify the state in which the rental was to occur, which I did.
I received somewhere around 2.7 million e-mails from Slate readers asking for help in the battle against poor customer service.
